channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What Economic Dangers Is the Bond Market Pricing In?
item.description: Even more so than stocks, bonds are often seen as an economic bellwether.

item.title: Starboard Value reportedly becomes latest activist investor to take Starbucks stake
item.description: With Starbucks Corp.’s stock in the midst of a hefty decline this year, activist investors continue to circle the coffee chain. The latest to do so, according to a report on Friday, is hedge fund Starboard Value.

item.title: The Score: Apple, Walt Disney, Eli Lilly and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: Trump Media narrows quarterly loss to $16.4 million
item.description: Truth Social parent ended June quarter with $344 million in cash, posts revenue of $837,000.

item.title: Wall Street Ends Wild Week in a Surprising Place
item.description: Inflation data next week could lead to more big stock swings, but corporate earnings have remained mostly upbeat.

item.title: The next big work perk? Getting your Amazon packages at the office. (Thanks, porch pirates.)
item.description: As businesses push for workers to return to their desks, the threat of porch piracy — the theft of packages left at people’s homes — looms large. So, a new approach may be merited.

item.title: Activist Starboard Value Takes Stake in Starbucks
item.description: Another activist hedge fund, Elliott Investment Management, is already agitating for changes at the coffee giant.

item.title: Is the economy headed for a hard or soft landing? Music fans think ‘recession pop’ has the answer.
item.description: Sahm rule, meet Spotify: Pop music is often in sync with economic downturns, economists told MarketWatch.

item.title: How to Stay Sane When Markets Get Wild
item.description: Market strategists and online pundits always have explanations for stock-market volatility. That doesn’t mean you have to believe them.

item.title: 10-, 30-year Treasury yields finish lower to close volatile week in bond market
item.description: Yields on U.S. government debt ended mixed on Friday but higher for the week, as investors assessed the fallout from a volatile period in fixed-income markets this week.
